message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a high-quality item that will meet your needs. I'm willing to offer it to you for $18,000.
Alice, I appreciate your offer, but $18,000 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $12,000 for the product.  This is my best offer, and I hope we can reach an agreement.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $18,000 is a bit steep, but I have to consider my minimum price. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. I'm counteroffering at $15,000.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $15,000 is still above what I'm comfortable paying. I'm willing to go up to $13,000. This is a fair price that allows both of us to make a profit. Let's work together to find a solution.

I understand that $13,000 is still a bit above your comfort zone, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go below $14,000 as it's still below my minimum price. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $13,000 and $15,000, so I'm counteroffering at $14,000.

Alice, I'm getting closer to my limit, but $14,000 is still a bit too high for me. Let's split the difference again - I'm offering $13,500.  This is my final offer, and if we can't reach an agreement, I'll have to look at other options.

I understand that you're getting close to your limit, Bob, but I'm not willing to go below $14,500. I'm trying to find a mutually beneficial price, so I'm willing to meet you halfway between $13,500 and $15,000. My counteroffer is $14,250.
